item.title: SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The SDS and Capacity Checklist is for frontline staff carrying out SDS assessments.
What does it do? 

The SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff provides a four step guide and links to relevant resources for assessing for capacity in relation to understanding the four SDS options.

How can you use it? 
The SDS and Capacity Checklist for Frontline Staff is designed to be printed on card and folded in concertina fashion so that it can be carried in a frontline worker’s purse or wallet. You can add the contact details for your local advocacy service.

item.title: Mental Health Self Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ)
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Mental Health Self Assessment Questionnaire is for people with mental health problems and mental health practitioners.
What does it do? 

The Mental Health Self Assessment Questionnaire is an alternative self-assessment questionnaire designed for people with fluctuating mental health. It provides an assessment of need when well and when unwell.

How can you use it? 
The Mental Health Self Assessment Questionnaire is designed to be completed electronically over a period of time. Responses are recorded and saved on the person’s own computer or laptop. It can also be downloaded and completed manually.

item.title: SDS and Customer Recovery Journey
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The SDS and Customer Recovery Journey is for other Alcohol and Drugs Partnerships embarking on SDS implementation.
What does it do? 

The SDS and Customer Recovery Journey illustrates how SDS could fit within the Aberdeenshire Alcohol and Drugs Partnership Customer Recovery Journey.

How can you use it? 
The SDS and Customer Recovery Journey is designed to illustrate where SDS fits within the recovery journey. It also illustrated where SDS peer workers can provide information and support to individuals in recovery.
